Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: FXYDECON Process
Screen.Label: 3D coherence enhancement by the F-X-Y Decon method.
HDR_FAST=
FAST_INIT=
FAST_INC=
FAST_LAST=
FAST_TOT=
NUM_TR_FAST=
HDR_SLOW=
SLOW_INIT=
SLOW_INC=
SLOW_LAST=
SLOW_TOT=
NUM_TR_SLOW=
NUM_PTS=
WIN_LEN =
OPT_FILL =
FREQ_BEG=
FREQ_END=
KEEP_LO_FREQ_DATA=

Help.Tip: Header word for more rapidly changing input trace coordinate.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - HDR_FAST
Header word for more rapidly changing input trace coordinate.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_FAST for the first trace.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - FAST_INIT
Value of HDR_FAST for the first trace.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment of HDR_FAST values for traces in the input volume.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - FAST_INC
Increment of HDR_FAST values for traces in the input volume.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int > 0

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_FAST for the last trace.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - FAST_LAST
Value of HDR_FAST for the last trace.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real >= FAST_INIT

Help.Tip: Total number of HDR_FAST values in the input trace volume.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - FAST_TOT
Total number of HDR_FAST values in the input trace volume.
 
 Default =
 Allowed = int > 0
 Total number of traces in the input volume in the fast direction.

Help.Tip: Number of traces for the prediction filter in the fast direction.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - NUM_TR_FAST
Number of traces for the prediction filter in the fast direction.
 
 Default = 15
 Allowed = odd int > 2*NUM_PTS
 NUM_TR_FAST is normally 3 to 5 times NUM_PTS.

Help.Tip: Header word for more slowly changing input trace coordinate.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - HDR_SLOW
Header word for more slowly changing input trace coordinate.
 
 Default = 8
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_SLOW for first trace.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - SLOW_INIT
Value of HDR_SLOW for first trace.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment of HDR_SLOW values for traces in the input volume.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - SLOW_INC
Increment of HDR_SLOW values for traces in the input volume.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int > 0

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_SLOW for last trace.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - SLOW_LAST
Value of HDR_SLOW for last trace.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real >= SLOW_INIT

Help.Tip: Total number of HDR_SLOW values in the input trace volume.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - SLOW_TOT
Total number of HDR_SLOW values in the input trace volume.
 
 Default =
 Allowed = int > 0
 Total number of traces in the input volume in the slow direction.

Help.Tip: Number of traces for the prediction filter in the slow direction.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - NUM_TR_SLOW
Number of traces for the prediction filter in the slow direction.
 
 Default = 15
 Allowed = odd int > 2*NUM_PTS
 NUM_TR_SLOW is normally 3 to 5 times NUM_PTS.

Help.Tip: Number of points for the filter design.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - NUM_PTS
Number of points for the filter design.
 
 Default = 5
 Allowed = 3 or 5
 The number of points for the prediction filter design is the same in the fast
 direction and in the slow direction.  The filter is either a 3*3 or 5*5
 matrix.

Help.Tip: Length, in seconds, of the local time window.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - WIN_LEN
Length, in seconds, of the local time window.
 
 Default = 0.6
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 Each trace group is broken into overlapping time windows of length WIN_LEN
 seconds for F-X-Y filtering.  It is not usually necessary to change the
 default.

Help.Tip: Option for handling Dead input Traces.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - OPT_FILL
Option for handling Dead input Traces.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES
 Allowed = NO
 Output traces corresponding dead input traces are set to zero.
 (OPT_FILL = NO), filled in (OPT_FILL = YES).
 Traces affected by the FILL option will always have their mute headers set to
 the first and last non-zero samples and header word 30 is set to 1.

Help.Tip: Minimum frequency for the F-X filter.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - FREQ_BEG
Minimum frequency for the F-X filter.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real >= 0.0

Help.Tip: Maximum frequency for the F-X filter.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - FREQ_END
Maximum frequency for the F-X filter.
 
 Default = Nyquist
 Allowed = Nyquist >= real > FREQ_BEG

Help.Tip: Keep original data from frquency 0 to FREQ_BEG-FREQ_INC
Help.Text:
fxydecon - KEEP_LO_FREQ_DATA
Keep original data from frquency 0 to FREQ_BEG-FREQ_INC
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES/NO
 If KEEP_LO_FREQ_DATA = YES, then no FXdecon noise attenuation applies
 to data from frquency 0 to FREQ_BEG-FREQ_INC. This helps to keep
 the low-frequency fault plane reflections.
 FREQ_INC = Nyquist frequency /(length of the FFT/2+1)
 If KEEP_LO_FREQ_DATA = NO, then FXdecon noise attenuation applies
 to data from frquency 0 to FREQ_BEG-FREQ_INC.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
fxydecon - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : FXYDECON    (F-X-Y Decon coherence enhancement)
 Category   : filters
 Written    : 2000-10-26   by: Stephen Chiu
 Revised    : 2006-06-12   by: B. Menger
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : 3D coherence enhancement by the F-X-Y Decon method.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : No.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 
 An input swath of data is written to a disk buffer which then provides
 rectangular subsets of traces (NUM_TR_FAST x NUM_TR_SLOW) to the F-X-Y filter
 routine for filtering.  The filtering is done separately for each time window
 within each rectangular subset of traces.  Windowing is overlapped in space
 and in time.
 
 Each trace subset is Fourier transformed over time to form the F-X-Y window.
 Then, for each frequency, a 3*3 or 5*5 prediction filter is derived.  These
 filters are convolved with the frequency slice of the input data to give the
 filtered output. This process is repeated for each frequency independently
 and the processed volume is inverse Fourier transformed to give the output
 time window.
 
 Theoretically, the trace spacing should be the same in the FAST and SLOW
 directions, but in practise, this algorithm works very well even if the trace
 spacing in the FAST and SLOW directions is not the same.
 
 
 Trace Coordinates and Output Sort Order
 
 The sort order of the input volume is described by the parameters HDR_FAST
 (the more rapidly changing header word) and HDR_SLOW (the more slowly
 changing header word).
 
 All keywords containing "FAST" relate to the direction parallel to the
 HDR_FAST coordinate.  All keywords containing "SLOW" relate to the direction
 parallel to the HDR_SLOW coordinate.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                            ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 
 FXYDECON is a 3D process.  For 2D work use FXDECON.
 
 
 Noise Attenuation and Parameter Choice
 
 NUM_PTS should be set to 3 if the dominant dip direction is parallel to either
 the FAST or SLOW direction.  If the dominant dip direction is not parallel to
 either the FAST or SLOW direction then NUM_PTS should be set to 5.
 Generally, fewer points in the filter design produce more noise attenuation
 and worse data fidelity, while more points in the filter design produce less
 noise attenuation and better data fidelity.
 
 Fewer traces in the filter design produce less noise attenuation and a less
 robust solution, while more traces in the filter design produce more noise
 attenuation and a more robust solution.  (Avoid setting the number of traces
 so large that curved events cannot be modeled as piece-wise linear by the
 linear prediction filter.)  In general, the number of traces in the filter
 design is 3 to 5 times the number of points.
 
 The data range of the FAST direction in FXYDECON should match with input
 data range of FAST direction. However The data range of the SLOW direction
 in FXYDECON is not required to match the input data range of the SLOW
 direction.
 
 If the edge of the 3D grid has zero traces, 1 extra trace for (NUM_PTS = 3)
 and 2 extra traces for (NUM_PTS = 5) will fill in along the edge of 3D grid.
 Users can use header word 30 = 1 to kill/delete the filled-in traces.
 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author       Description
     ----        ------       -----------
 14. 2006-06-12  B. Menger    Removed Unused Variables.
 13. 2004-02-12  S.Chiu       Add better data-range checking and update Doc.
 12. 2003-06-02  S.Chiu       Fix overflow memory bug.
 11. 2002-05-09  S.Chiu       Add options of KEEP_LO_FREQ_DATA, FREQ_BEG, and
                              FREQ_END.
 10. 2001-08-27  S.Chiu       Add fill in option.
 9.  2001-08-02  S.Chiu       If SLOW_INIT from data is greater than SLOW_INIT
                              from user input, reset SLOW_INIT from data.
 8.  2001-06-22  S.Chiu       Fix missing data problem.
 7.  2001-06-14  S.Chiu       Add more error checking to detect if data are
                              out of range.
 6.  2001-05-14  S.Chiu       Fix overflow problem in least-squares solution
                              and frontend problems.
 5.  2001-03-21  S.Chiu       Add pc_get_update_state() /= PC_GUI in checking
                              parameters.
 4.  2001-03-12  S.Chiu       Update document of header word 48 only.
 3.  2001-02-15  S.Chiu       Change wrapped_up to skip_wrapup.
 2.  2000-12-05  S.Chiu       Changed not to store the whole data volume in
                              disk before output. Process and output a swath
                              of data at the same time.
 1.  2000-10-26  S.Chiu       Created original version
